properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy wet snow expected tonight through Sunday afternoon. A strong spring storm system will bring a rain and snow mix to the area tonight through Sunday. Highly localized total snowfall amounts up to 10 cm are possible by Sunday afternoon. Untreated surfaces may become slippery. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-29T17:01:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T01:02:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3379859934.2020
Area: Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake, Nipigon - Rossport, Marathon - Schreiber
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Adverse Winter Driving Conditions Due to Heavy Snow This Weekend. An unseasonably cool spring storm will deliver significant snow to the high mountain passes of southern B.C. Today, intense bursts of flurries will add further accumulations. Gusty winds will reduce visibilities in blowing snow. Snow levels will be unseasonably low, hovering between 1100 and 1400 metres. A transition from rain at the lower elevations to heavy snow near the passes will make for adverse winter driving conditions. Motorists are encouraged to consider delaying travel plans until early next week when the snow will ease in the mountains. Drivers should be prepared for winter driving conditions and are reminded that winter tires are mandatory until April 30th. Please check the highway forecasts before heading out and stay tuned for potential snowfall warnings. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T03:00:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T11:01:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4208597109.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected Sunday through Monday morning. A strong low pressure system will bring snow, heavy at times, into the area starting early Sunday morning. The snow may become wet Sunday afternoon and will continue Sunday night before tapering off Monday morning. Highly localized total snowfall amounts up to 15 cm are possible by Monday morning. Untreated surfaces may become slippery. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-29T17:02:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T01:03:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1359154366.2020

properties.Title: Emergency Advisory Alert Issued By Ministry Of Health
properties.Summary:
Description: This Emergency Advisory Alert is being issued by the Ministry of Health. If you or somebody you know attended the Christopher Lake snowmobile rally and supper on Saturday, March 14, you are advised to contact the Prince Albert Communicable Disease Team at 306-765-6504 as soon as possible. If you are experiencing signs of fever, coughing, or breathing issues, call 811 immediately.
Expires: 2020-03-31T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-03-29T08:59:04-06:00, 67E0D7A0-863A-9340-5B29-1D894AFA41ED
Area: North Central Saskatchewan

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A total of 15 to 25 centimetres of snow are forecast over these regions by Monday afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system from the United States will affect the province of Quebec Sunday and Monday. Snowfall amounts in excess of 15 centimetres are possible for Central Quebec. However, precipitation amounts could vary widely depending on the area as temperatures will be near the freezing mark. Some areas near the St. Lawrence and south of the river could primarily see rain, while higher terrain may see up to 25 centimetres of snow locally. Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult locally. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-29T19:18:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T03:19:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3689007359.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An unseasonably cool spring storm will bring a long period of snowfall over the highway passes this weekend with 15 to 30 cm of snow expected for Rogers Pass and Kootenay Pass. The Coquihalla Hope to Merritt segment may see 15 cm. As a cold front sweeps across the province on Sunday, an unsettled airmass will result in brief but intense bursts of flurries over the highways with sudden reduction in visibility due to heavy snow. Be aware of sudden changes in road conditions and visibility, particularly near the highway summits. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T02:59:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T11:00:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3932781185.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass, Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt, Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots and frequent lightning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Update To Civil Emergency Alert Issued By Government Of Saskatchewan
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for Civil Emergency Alert issued by Government of Saskatchewan. This Alert is issued by the Government of Saskatchewan. If you are returning to Canada from foreign travel, you MUST self-isolate for 14 days. This includes travel from the US, which now has more COVID 19 cases than any country in the world. It is the law.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain today. Rain, heavy at times, is forecast to develop early this morning and continue through most of the day. Embedded thunderstorms are likely to accompany the rain at times. Total rainfall amounts of 25 to 40 mm are likely, with the highest amounts expected where thunderstorms occur. The ground in the area remains partially frozen. Since frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb rainfall, winter criteria thresholds of 25 mm with 24 hours is being used for this Rainfall Warning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Remarks: Freezing rain mixed with ice pellets is expected to taper to freezing drizzle and flurries later this afternoon. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
